1.text: O give thanks unto the LORD; call upon his name: make known his deeds among the people.

2.text: Sing unto him, sing psalms unto him: talk ye of all his wondrous works.

3.text: Glory ye in his holy name: let the heart of them rejoice that seek the LORD.

4.text: Seek the LORD, and his strength: seek his face evermore.

5.text: Remember his marvellous works that he hath done; his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth;

6.text: O ye seed of Abraham his servant, ye children of Jacob his chosen.

7.text: He is the LORD our God: his judgments are in all the earth.

8.text: He hath remembered his covenant for ever, the word which he commanded to a thousand generations.

9.text: Which covenant he made with Abraham, and his oath unto Isaac;

10.text: And confirmed the same unto Jacob for a law, and to Israel for an everlasting covenant:

11.text: Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance:

12.text: When they were but a few men in number; yea, very few, and strangers in it.

13.text: When they went from one nation to another, from one kingdom to another people;

14.text: He suffered no man to do them wrong: yea, he reproved kings for their sakes;

15.text: Saying, Touch not mine anointed, and do my prophets no harm.

16.text: Moreover he called for a famine upon the land: he brake the whole staff of bread.

17.text: He sent a man before them, even Joseph, who was sold for a servant:

18.text: Whose feet they hurt with fetters: he was laid in iron:

19.text: Until the time that his word came: the word of the LORD tried him.

20.text: The king sent and loosed him; even the ruler of the people, and let him go free.

21.text: He made him lord of his house, and ruler of all his substance:

22.text: To bind his princes at his pleasure; and teach his senators wisdom.

23.text: Israel also came into Egypt; and Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.

24.text: And he increased his people greatly; and made them stronger than their enemies.

25.text: He turned their heart to hate his people, to deal subtilly with his servants.

26.text: He sent Moses his servant; and Aaron whom he had chosen.

27.text: They shewed his signs among them, and wonders in the land of Ham.

28.text: He sent darkness, and made it dark; and they rebelled not against his word.

29.text: He turned their waters into blood, and slew their fish.

30.text: Their land brought forth frogs in abundance, in the chambers of their kings.

31.text: He spake, and there came divers sorts of flies, and lice in all their coasts.

32.text: He gave them hail for rain, and flaming fire in their land.

33.text: He smote their vines also and their fig trees; and brake the trees of their coasts.

34.text: He spake, and the locusts came, and caterpillers, and that without number,

35.text: And did eat up all the herbs in their land, and devoured the fruit of their ground.

36.text: He smote also all the firstborn in their land, the chief of all their strength.

37.text: He brought them forth also with silver and gold: and there was not one feeble person among their tribes.

38.text: Egypt was glad when they departed: for the fear of them fell upon them.

39.text: He spread a cloud for a covering; and fire to give light in the night.

40.text: The people asked, and he brought quails, and satisfied them with the bread of heaven.

41.text: He opened the rock, and the waters gushed out; they ran in the dry places like a river.

42.text: For he remembered his holy promise, and Abraham his servant.

43.text: And he brought forth his people with joy, and his chosen with gladness:

44.text: And gave them the lands of the heathen: and they inherited the labour of the people;

45.text: That they might observe his statutes, and keep his laws. Praise ye the LORD.
